nio/DynamicReplicator.Description:
Each incoming signal is replicated x times, where x is the number of items in the list that `list` evaluates to. Each output signal will be the same as the input signal with a new attribute, `title`, set to a value of the list.
If `list` fails to evaluate, then `title` will be set to `None` and one signal will be notified.

title.description: Name of attribute to be added with list value.

list.description: An expression property that needs to evaluate to a list. A signal will be notified from the block for each item in the list.

nio/DynamicReplicator.Input: It is likely that the signal will have a field from which `list` will reference.
nio/DynamicReplicator.Output: Creates a new signal for each value in `list`. The new signals have a new attribute `title` that is the value of the list item.
